title: Front Fork - Right Hand - Assembly

body.body: Warning - Front forks have precision machined parts
The front forks comprise of many precision machined parts. Total cleanliness must be observed at all times and assembly must take place in a dirt/dust-free environment.
Dirt ingress may cause damage to the fork parts, leading to incorrect operation, instability, loss of motorcycle control or an accident.
will be used extensively. In the text, reference to a plain end and a stepped end will be made. This describes the two ends of the tool as shown in the diagram below.
If removed, refit the lower bush to the inner tube.
Lubricate the upper and lower bushes for the inner tube with clean fork oil.
Fit the damping cylinder seat into the lower end of the fork inner tube.
Fit the damping cylinder into the fork inner tube.
Fit a new sealing washer to the damping cylinder bolt then apply locking compound (ThreeBond 1342) to the bolt threads.
Ensure the damping cylinder and seat are correctly located in the outer tube then fit the damping cylinder bolt. Tighten the damping cylinder bolt to

body.name: Front fork damper seat sit correct kagj 1

body.body: Slide the top bush along the inner tube and locate it in the outer tube. Drift the bush into position using the plain end of
Keep the fork fully compressed whilst installing the bush, oil seal and circlip. Any accidental damage to the inner tube will then be confined to the area which is normally above the oil seal.
Slide the washer along the inner tube and locate it in the outer tube.

Lubricate the lip of the new oil seal with fork oil. Ensure the seal is the correct way around then ease it onto the inner tube. Gently drift the seal into position in the outer tube using the stepped end of
Secure the oil seal in position with the circlip, ensuring it is correctly located in its groove.
Fit the new dust seal onto the inner tube and gently drift it into position in the outer tube using the stepped end of

body.name: Front Fork dust seal with T3880184

body.body: Refill the fork with new oil (see
Fork Oil Change - Oil Refilling - Right Hand Fork
